alert.note: Alert for Petersburg Borough (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 12 at 6:24PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 AM AKDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Falls Creek near counties around Falls Creek. * WHEN...Until 215 AM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 623 PM AKDT, satellite estimates and rain gauge data indicate heavy rain arriving across the advisory area. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly, especially near Falls Creek. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.1-0.3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible. - For Falls Creek near Petersburg: At 6:00pm the stage was 21.92 feet. Flood Stage is 22.5 feet. Impacts: At 24.0 feet: Water levels will be at the bridge abutment of 9 mile bridge along Mitkof Highway.
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
